newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Kegalle up 10 pct on retail buying.
newsitem.headline: Kegalle up 10 pct on retail buying.

text.p: Kegalle Plantations Ltd rose 10 percent or two rupees to 22 on retail buying of 1,000 shares on Wednesday morning, brokers said.
"Tea prices being at almost an all-time high has sent retail investors chasing plantation sector shares," said a trader specialising in retail activity.
Plantation sector shares are also liquid and cheap enough to attract retail buying, he said.
Brokers said there was buying interest even in companies not directly in the plantation sector.

Tea Smallholder Factories Ltd, which processes leaf bought from small-scale tea cultivators, and Merchant Bank of Sri Lanka, which has large exposure to the industry after underwriting plantation privatisations, were also in demand.
